line_1: The Nymph beheld the weeping Chief; nor knew,
line_2: For what he wept, nor whom she came to view:

line_1: For what he wept, nor whom she came to view:

line_1: His Martial Dress, bespangled o'er with Gold,
line_2: The dreadful Warrior, not the Lover, told:

line_1: But, when he cast the Helmet from his Head,
line_2: And thro' the Gates the blushing Damsel led;

line_1: And thro' the Gates the blushing Damsel led;
line_2: But, when he cast the Helmet from his Head,

line_1: She knew her Lover, clasp'd him to her Breast,
line_2: While silent Eloquence her Joy confest:

line_1: While silent Eloquence her Joy confest:
line_2: She knew her Lover, clasp'd him to her Breast,

line_1: The conscious Pains an absent Lover bears,
line_2: Despair, fallacious Hope, and anxious Fears,

line_1: The conscious Pains an absent Lover bears,
line_2: For want of Words, were painted with their Tears.

line_1: And when, at length, their crystal Sluices ceas'd,
line_2: The joyful Hero thus the Nymph address'd:

line_1: The joyful Hero thus the Nymph address'd:
line_2: And when, at length, their crystal Sluices ceas'd,

line_1: YE Gods! and have I then my Charmer found?
line_2: And are my Labours thus completely crown'd!

line_1: And are my Labours thus completely crown'd!
line_2: YE Gods! and have I then my Charmer found?

line_1: Yes! let me clasp thee to my longing Arms,
line_2: Drink in thy Breath, and feed upon thy Charms.

line_1: Drink in thy Breath, and feed upon thy Charms.
line_2: Yes! let me clasp thee to my longing Arms,

line_1: As widow'd Turtles, roving round the Fields,
line_2: Thro' all the fruitful Stores, which Nature yields,

line_1: Thro' all the fruitful Stores, which Nature yields,
line_2: As widow'd Turtles, roving round the Fields,

line_1: Curst in the midst of Plenty, cannot eat;
line_2: But starve, lamenting for their absent Mate:

line_1: But starve, lamenting for their absent Mate:
line_2: Curst in the midst of Plenty, cannot eat;

line_1: Thus have I been with Fame and Riches grac'd;
line_2: Yet wanted thee, to give my Riches Taste.

line_1: Yet wanted thee, to give my Riches Taste.
line_2: Thus have I been with Fame and Riches grac'd;

line_1: But say, how came this Wealth I wanted most?
line_2: What brought my Love to this Barbarian Coast?

line_1: What brought my Love to this Barbarian Coast?
line_2: But say, how came this Wealth I wanted most?

line_1: HE said; and now the joyful Damsel spake
line_2: The Dangers which she suffer'd for his sake;

line_1: The Dangers which she suffer'd for his sake;
line_2: HE said; and now the joyful Damsel spake

line_1: Shews him the Dame, who found her on the Tide;
line_2: PRISCILLA too, who all her Wants supply'd:

line_1: PRISCILLA too, who all her Wants supply'd:
line_2: Shews him the Dame, who found her on the Tide;

line_1: Then, prostrate, on her Knees before him bends,
line_2: And begs him to reward her faithful Friends.

line_1: And begs him to reward her faithful Friends.
line_2: Then, prostrate, on her Knees before him bends,

line_1: The grateful Chief, by native Goodness sway'd,
line_2: Embrac'd 'em both, and soon the Nymph obey'd;

line_1: Embrac'd 'em both, and soon the Nymph obey'd;
line_2: The grateful Chief, by native Goodness sway'd,

line_1: But first before his Royal Master came,
line_2: And begs he may resign his Post of Fame:

line_1: And begs he may resign his Post of Fame:
line_2: But first before his Royal Master came,

line_1: At which the Monarch frowns with awful Eyes,
line_2: Till FELIX straight, who saw his Passion rise,

line_1: Till FELIX straight, who saw his Passion rise,
line_2: At which the Monarch frowns with awful Eyes,

line_1: Falls on the Ground, and to his Master shows
line_2: The various Scene of all his am'rous Woes.

line_1: The various Scene of all his am'rous Woes.
line_2: Falls on the Ground, and to his Master shows

line_1: This heard, the King resumes his former Grace;
line_2: Love tun'd his Soul, and smooth'd his ruffled Face:

line_1: Love tun'd his Soul, and smooth'd his ruffled Face:
line_2: This heard, the King resumes his former Grace;

line_1: He rais'd the Hero, bids the Nymph appear;
line_2: The Nymph approach'd him with a modest Fear;

line_1: The Nymph approach'd him with a modest Fear;
line_2: He rais'd the Hero, bids the Nymph appear;

line_1: Before his awful Throne, submiss, she fell,
line_2: And to him straight unfolds th'amazing Tale.

line_1: And to him straight unfolds th'amazing Tale.
line_2: Before his awful Throne, submiss, she fell,

line_1: Mute, on the Ground a-while he fix'd his Eyes;
line_2: Then, Is the Force of Love so great? he cries:

line_1: Then, Is the Force of Love so great? he cries:
line_2: Mute, on the Ground a-while he fix'd his Eyes;

line_1: We falsely Man the World's Commander call;
line_2: Thou, mightier Monarch, Love! commandest All:

line_1: Thou, mightier Monarch, Love! commandest All:
line_2: We falsely Man the World's Commander call;

line_1: Young AMMON's Self could not thy Pow'r confine;
line_2: The World his Subject was, but He was thine.

line_1: The World his Subject was, but He was thine.
line_2: Young AMMON's Self could not thy Pow'r confine;

line_1: THEN, smiling, thus he chear'd the trembling Fair:
line_2: Henceforward, lovely Nymph, dismiss thy Care;

line_1: Henceforward, lovely Nymph, dismiss thy Care;
line_2: THEN, smiling, thus he chear'd the trembling Fair:

line_1: For, since thy Love has conquer'd Wind and Sea,
line_2: Curst be the King, that's crueller than they!

line_1: Curst be the King, that's crueller than they!
line_2: For, since thy Love has conquer'd Wind and Sea,

line_1: Let HYMEN straight confirm the Marriage Ties;
line_2: Thou justly hast deserv'd the Nuptial Prize.

line_1: Thou justly hast deserv'd the Nuptial Prize.
line_2: Let HYMEN straight confirm the Marriage Ties;

line_1: THUS said, he crown'd the Hero's Martial Care,
line_2: With Riches far superior to the Fair:

line_1: With Riches far superior to the Fair:
line_2: THUS said, he crown'd the Hero's Martial Care,

line_1: Due Thanks return'd, they to PRISCILLA came,
line_2: Bestowing Gifts and Honours on the Dame:

line_1: Bestowing Gifts and Honours on the Dame:
line_2: Due Thanks return'd, they to PRISCILLA came,

line_1: CAPRESA next, with Age and Labour worn,
line_2: In comely Robes the grateful Pair adorn;

line_1: In comely Robes the grateful Pair adorn;
line_2: CAPRESA next, with Age and Labour worn,

line_1: With ample Wealth her former Bliss restor'd,
line_2: And from the Seas redeem'd her Nuptial Lord;

line_1: And from the Seas redeem'd her Nuptial Lord;
line_2: With ample Wealth her former Bliss restor'd,

line_1: Her Nuptial Lord again enjoys his Wife,
line_2: Again delightful Freedom crowns his Life;

line_1: Again delightful Freedom crowns his Life;
line_2: Her Nuptial Lord again enjoys his Wife,

line_1: Till Nature calls him to resign his Breath,
line_2: In honourable Age, and peaceful Death.

line_1: In honourable Age, and peaceful Death.
line_2: Till Nature calls him to resign his Breath,

line_1: THIS done, the loving Couple quit the Shore,
line_2: And joyfully the destin'd Port explore;

line_1: And joyfully the destin'd Port explore;
line_2: THIS done, the loving Couple quit the Shore,

line_1: While sportive NEREIDS round their Vessel play,
line_2: And wanton CUPIDS hail 'em on their Way;

line_1: And wanton CUPIDS hail 'em on their Way;
line_2: While sportive NEREIDS round their Vessel play,

line_1: Rough THETIS' Self assumes a pleasing Smile,
line_2: Glad to return 'em to their native Soil;

line_1: Glad to return 'em to their native Soil;
line_2: Rough THETIS' Self assumes a pleasing Smile,

line_1: Where sacred HYMEN join'd their mutual Hands,
line_2: And Heav'n, indulgent, bless'd their Nuptial Bands.
